You can connect to zoom: following this link: (https://grenoble-inp.zoom.us/j/99257491674?pwd=YUhJTTRhaWt1NWp0d2doNzh0c0hUUT09) (and, if needed, install the zoom app). or you can start the Zoom app with the following information meeting ID: 992 5749 1674 Password: ECO3 Class platforms We will use Caseine Caseine page is: (https://moodle.caseine.org/course/view.php?id=346)

item.title: Exercice Penalty ALLISON
item.description: EXERCISE inspired from Paul Allison : logistic regression using SAS, 2nd Ed. Dans cet exercice une attention particulière est donnée aux erreurs d’interprétations. Pour cela la thèmatique est délibérément lourde et sensible, pour forcer à prendre des précautions avant les conclusions attives. Les données sont décrites dans Allison (2010) Data set consists of 147 death penalty cases in the state of New Jersey. The defendant was convicted of first-degree murder with a recommendation by the prosecutor that a death sentence be imposed.

item.title: First Lesson October 1rst 2020
item.description: First Lesson Welcome to the first lesson - 05/10/2020 9:00 - 12:00 Introduction These Introduction slides present: Table of contents Introduction Program Motivations Importance of DCM Course Objectives General Context of Choice analysis Four broad frameworks Sample and Measurement Issues in Model Building R and Tests for Categorical Data Inference for a (Single) Proportion Two-Way Contingency Tables The Odds-Ratio Chi-Squared Tests of Independence Zoom meeting We will use Zoom.
Recordings Recordings of the lessons are accessible on GoogleDrive

Welcome This is the welcome page You find here lesson materials description and abstract links to the Caseine Platform use of the posts description of the evaluation references and other things… Lessons planning Each lesson is described as follows Lesson Duration Topic Activities Lesson 1 3 hours Introduction: DCM with R Lesson: DCM overview Exercise: reminder of R and Rmarkdown applied to Categorical variables statistical tests Lesson 2 3 hours Binary logistic Regression Lesson: Linear Probability model Logistic regression specification Estimation and inference Exercise: Effect of PSI Lesson 3 3 hours Guided work: Binary Logistic Regression Exercise: Death Penalty ; Binary Women role ; Titanic survival rate Lesson 4 3 hours Project Presentation Discussion on the project and the raised difficulties Lesson 5 3 hours Discret Choice Model (RUM) Lesson: Discret Choice in Microeconomics Probabilistic Discret choice Binary choice Model Economic Outputs in DCM Exercise: Transport mode choice Lesson 6 3 hours Multiple choice Model Lesson: Multinomial Logit model ; Specification and estimation ; IIA assumption Exercise: Transport mode choice Lesson 7 3 hours Discrete Choice Model Extensions Lesson: Exercise: Ordered Logit on Wallet data ; Nested logit in transport Lesson 8 3 hours Project Defense Student defense of their final project Posts Posts will be used to manage the contact (prof \(\rightarrow\) student), as notification during the semester

item.title: About
item.description: Description of the course Enseignant : Iragaël Joly 1, MCF HDR, Grenoble INP Génie industriel Contenu : L’objectif du cours est de présenter et appliquer les méthodes économétriques de modélisations des variables qualitatives et des choix discrets. Les premières sont adaptées pour modéliser des outcomes qualitatifs ordonnés ou non (par ex : modèles logit et probit). Les modèles de choix discrets sont utilisés pour l’étude désagrégée des comportements individuels de consommation et l’étude de la demande.

item.title: Introduction to Reproducible Analysis
item.description: Reproducible Analysis Typical data analysis workflow looks like this: collect data put it in a file or spreadsheet or database run some analyses, written in various scripts, perhaps saving some intermediate results along the way or maybe always working on the raw data. create some plots or tables of relevant summaries of the data, and then go and write a report about the results in a text editor or word processor.
